chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sydney M Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,399.63 and restitution surcharge. The Defendant stipulates to the amount of restitution. $1,000.00 has been paid toward the restitution and disbursed to the vicitm through the Clerk of Courts Office.
-----------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
-----------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
-----------------------------

One apology letter addressed to both deputies to be submitted to Agent on or before February 18, 2015.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------
AODA assessment if not already complated.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sydney M Hamilton in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prelminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
SPD Notice that the defendant does qualify for an attorney.
Defendant Sydney Hamilton present in court. Daniel Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO NON-PROFESSIONAL CONTACT WITH DEPUTY SHAW OR BLANCHARD.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
